storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to create shift templates to achieve standardized shift definitions

testCases.title: Validate successful creation of shift template with valid data
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
User has role-based access to shift template management
Shift template management page is accessible
No existing shift templates with conflicting time ranges exist

steps.action: Navigate to shift template creation page by clicking on 'Shift Templates' menu and selecting 'Create New Template'
steps.expectedResult: Shift template form is displayed with fields for template name, start time, end time, and break details. All fields are empty and enabled for input

steps.action: Enter valid shift template name (e.g., 'Morning Shift'), start time (e.g., '08:00 AM'), end time (e.g., '04:00 PM'), and break details (e.g., '30 minutes at 12:00 PM')
steps.expectedResult: All input fields accept the data without any validation errors. Data is displayed correctly in the respective fields with proper formatting

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Submit' button to create the shift template
steps.expectedResult: System validates the input, processes the request, displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Shift template created successfully'), and redirects to the shift template list page showing the newly created template

postconditions: New shift template is saved in the ShiftTemplates table
Shift template appears in the template list with all entered details
Template is available for future use and editing
System response time is under 2 seconds

testCases.title: Verify rejection of overlapping shift template creation
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
At least one shift template already exists in the system (e.g., 'Morning Shift' from 08:00 AM to 04:00 PM)
User has access to shift template creation page

steps.action: Navigate to shift template creation page by clicking on 'Shift Templates' menu and selecting 'Create New Template'
steps.expectedResult: Shift template form is displayed with all input fields empty and ready for data entry

steps.action: Enter shift template name (e.g., 'Overlapping Shift'), start time that overlaps with existing template (e.g., '10:00 AM'), and end time (e.g., '06:00 PM') that creates an overlap with the existing 08:00 AM - 04:00 PM template
steps.expectedResult: System detects the overlap and displays a validation error message (e.g., 'This shift template overlaps with existing template: Morning Shift'). Error message is clearly visible near the conflicting fields or at the top of the form

steps.action: Attempt to submit the form by clicking the 'Save' or 'Submit' button
steps.expectedResult: Form submission is blocked. System displays an error notification preventing the creation (e.g., 'Cannot create overlapping shift templates. Please adjust the time range'). The form remains on the screen with entered data intact

postconditions: No new shift template is created in the database
Existing shift templates remain unchanged
User remains on the creation form to correct the input
Error message is clearly communicated to the user

testCases.title: Validate editing and deletion of existing shift templates
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
At least two shift templates exist in the system for testing edit and delete operations
Templates are not currently assigned to any employee schedules
User has access to shift template management page

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list page by clicking on 'Shift Templates' menu
steps.expectedResult: Complete list of existing shift templates is displayed in a table or grid format showing template names, start times, end times, break details, and action buttons (Edit, Delete)

steps.action: Select a template from the list (e.g., 'Morning Shift') and click the 'Edit' button or icon
steps.expectedResult: Edit form is displayed with all current template data pre-populated in the respective fields (template name, start time, end time, break details). All fields are editable

steps.action: Modify one or more fields (e.g., change end time from '04:00 PM' to '05:00 PM') and click 'Save' or 'Update' button
steps.expectedResult: System validates the changes, updates the template in the database, displays a success confirmation message (e.g., 'Shift template updated successfully'), and redirects to the template list showing the updated information

steps.action: Select a different template from the list and click the 'Delete' button or icon
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation prompt dialog with message (e.g., 'Are you sure you want to delete this shift template? This action cannot be undone') with 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' options

steps.action: Click 'Confirm' button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: Template is removed from the database, confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift template deleted successfully'), and the template list is automatically refreshed showing the updated list without the deleted template

postconditions: Edited template is updated in the ShiftTemplates table with new values
Deleted template is removed from the ShiftTemplates table
Template list reflects all changes immediately
No orphaned data remains in the system
All operations complete within 2 seconds

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to delete obsolete shift templates to maintain template accuracy

testCases.title: Validate successful deletion of unassigned shift template
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
At least one shift template exists that is not assigned to any employee schedule
User has role-based access to delete shift templates
Shift template list page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list page by clicking on 'Shift Templates' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Template list is displayed showing all existing shift templates with columns for template name, start time, end time, assignment status, and action buttons. Unassigned templates are clearly identifiable

steps.action: Identify an unassigned template (e.g., 'Obsolete Evening Shift') and click the 'Delete' button or icon associated with that template
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation dialog with message (e.g., 'Are you sure you want to delete the shift template: Obsolete Evening Shift? This action cannot be undone') with 'Confirm' and 'Cancel' buttons

steps.action: Click the 'Confirm' button in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: System processes the deletion request, removes the template from the ShiftTemplates table, displays a success message (e.g., 'Shift template deleted successfully'), and automatically refreshes the template list showing the updated list without the deleted template

postconditions: Selected shift template is permanently removed from the database
Template list is updated and no longer shows the deleted template
No references to the deleted template remain in the system
Deletion operation completes in under 2 seconds
Success confirmation is displayed to the user

testCases.title: Verify prevention of deletion for assigned shift template
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager with valid credentials
At least one shift template exists that is currently assigned to one or more employee schedules
User has access to shift template management page
System has validation logic to check template assignments before deletion

steps.action: Navigate to shift template list and identify a template that is assigned to schedules (e.g., 'Day Shift' assigned to 5 employees)
steps.expectedResult: Template list displays the assigned template with an indicator showing it is in use. Delete option/button is visible and available for selection

steps.action: Click the 'Delete' button or icon for the assigned template
steps.expectedResult: System checks the template assignment status in the EmployeeSchedules table and displays an error message (e.g., 'Cannot delete this shift template. It is currently assigned to 5 employee schedules. Please reassign or remove schedules before deleting') preventing the deletion. No confirmation dialog appears

steps.action: Click 'OK' or 'Close' button on the error message dialog to dismiss it
steps.expectedResult: Error dialog closes and user returns to the template list. The assigned template remains in the list unchanged with all its data intact

postconditions: Assigned shift template remains in the ShiftTemplates table
All employee schedule assignments remain intact
Template list shows the template with its assignment status unchanged
User is informed why deletion was prevented
No data integrity issues occur

storyTitle: As HR Manager, I want to search and filter shift templates to quickly find relevant templates

testCases.title: Validate search by shift template name
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has role-based access to shift template management
Multiple shift templates exist in the system with varying names
Shift template list page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template list page by clicking on 'Shift Templates' menu option
steps.expectedResult: Template list page is displayed showing all available shift templates with search bar visible at the top

steps.action: Enter a search keyword in the search field that matches an existing template name (e.g., 'Morning')
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list is displayed showing only templates with names containing 'Morning', search results appear within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify the filtered results display only matching templates
steps.expectedResult: All displayed templates contain the search keyword in their name or description, non-matching templates are hidden

steps.action: Clear the search field by clicking the clear button or deleting the text
steps.expectedResult: Search field is empty and the full list of all templates is restored and displayed

steps.action: Verify all templates are visible after clearing search
steps.expectedResult: Complete list of shift templates is displayed without any filters applied

postconditions: Search field is cleared
Full template list is displayed
No filters are active
System is ready for next operation

testCases.title: Verify filtering by shift type
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has role-based access to shift template management
Multiple shift templates exist with different shift types (e.g., Day, Night, Evening)
Shift template list page is accessible
Filter controls are visible on the page

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template list page
steps.expectedResult: Template list page is displayed with all templates and filter dropdown visible

steps.action: Click on the shift type filter dropdown and select a specific shift type (e.g., 'Day Shift')
steps.expectedResult: List updates within 2 seconds to show only templates with the selected 'Day Shift' type, other shift types are filtered out

steps.action: Verify filtered results show only the selected shift type
steps.expectedResult: All displayed templates are of 'Day Shift' type, count of results is updated accordingly

steps.action: Enter a search keyword in the search field while the shift type filter is active
steps.expectedResult: List shows only templates that match both the selected shift type AND the search keyword, results display within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify combined filter results are accurate
steps.expectedResult: Displayed templates meet both criteria: correct shift type and contain search keyword

steps.action: Clear the search field and remove the shift type filter by selecting 'All Types' or clicking clear filters button
steps.expectedResult: All filters are removed and the complete list of all templates is displayed

steps.action: Verify full list is restored
steps.expectedResult: All shift templates are visible regardless of type or name

postconditions: All filters are cleared
Search field is empty
Full template list is displayed
Filter controls are reset to default state

testCases.title: Validate sorting and pagination of templates
preconditions: User is logged in as HR Manager
User has role-based access to shift template management
More than 10 shift templates exist in the system to enable pagination
Templates have different creation dates and names
Shift template list page is accessible
Pagination is configured to display a specific number of items per page

steps.action: Navigate to the shift template list page
steps.expectedResult: Template list page is displayed with default sorting, pagination controls visible at the bottom

steps.action: Click on the 'Creation Date' column header or select 'Sort by Creation Date - Ascending' from sort dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Templates are reordered with oldest templates first, sorting completes within 2 seconds, sort indicator shows ascending order

steps.action: Verify the templates are sorted correctly by creation date in ascending order
steps.expectedResult: Templates are displayed in chronological order from oldest to newest based on creation date

steps.action: Click the 'Next' button or page number '2' in the pagination controls
steps.expectedResult: Next set of templates is displayed (e.g., items 11-20), page indicator updates to show page 2, navigation completes within 2 seconds

steps.action: Verify pagination navigation is successful
steps.expectedResult: Different set of templates is displayed, page number indicator shows current page as 2, previous page button becomes enabled

steps.action: Click on the 'Name' column header or select 'Sort by Name - Descending' from sort dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Templates on current page reorder alphabetically in descending order (Z to A), sorting completes within 2 seconds, sort indicator shows descending order

steps.action: Verify templates are sorted by name in descending order
steps.expectedResult: Templates are displayed in reverse alphabetical order by name, sorting is maintained across the current page

steps.action: Navigate back to page 1 using pagination controls
steps.expectedResult: First page of templates is displayed with the descending name sort order maintained

postconditions: Templates remain sorted by the last selected sort option
Pagination controls are functional
User can continue navigating and sorting as needed
System maintains sort preference during session
